epirice 0.0.0.9000
  • Get started
  • Reference

Susceptible-Exposed-Infectious-Removed (SEIR) model

SEIR.Rd

This function is used by specific disease models in EPIRICE to model disease severity of several rice diseases. It should be generic enough to port to other pathosystems given proper values.

SEIR(
  wth,
  emergence,
  onset = 15,
  duration = 120,
  rhlim = 90,
  rainlim = 5,
  wetness = 0,
  init_sites,
  init_infection = 1,
  age_rc,
  tmp_rc,
  rh_rc,
  base_rc,
  latrans,
  inftrans,
  site_max,
  aggr,
  rr_physiol_senesc,
  rrg,
  senesc_type = 1
)

Arguments

wth

a data frame of weather on a daily time-step containing data with the following field names.

  • YYYYMMDD Date in YYYY-MM-DD format

  • DOY Numeric day of year, e.g. 1 - 365

  • T2M Mean daily temperature

  • T2MN Minimum daily temperature

  • T2MX Maximum daily temperature

  • RH2M Relative humidity

  • RAIN Precipitation
emergence

expected date of plant emergence entered in YYYY-MM-DD format (usually supplied through the disease model function)
onset

expected number of days until the onset of disease after emergence date
duration

simulation duration, usually 120 days
rhlim

threshold to decide whether leaves are wet or not (usually 90 %)
rainlim

threshold to decide whether leaves are wet or not
wetness

simulate RHmax or rain threshold (0) or leaf wetness duration (1)
init_sites

Initial number of plant's healthy sites
init_infection

Initial number of infective sites
age_rc

crop age curve for pathogen optimum
tmp_rc

temperature curve for pathogen optimum
rh_rc

relative curve for pathogen optimum
base_rc

corrected basic infection rate
latrans

latent period
inftrans

infectious period
site_max

NA
aggr

NA
rr_physiol_senesc

relative rate of physiological senescence
rrg

NA
senesc_type

NA

Value

A data.table containing the following columns

simday:Zero indexed day of simulation that was run.
dates:Date of simulation.
sites:Total number of sites present on day "x".
latent:Number of latent sites present on day "x".
infectious:Number of infectious sites present on day "x".
removed:Number of removed sites present on day "x".
senesced:Number of senesced sites present on day "x".
rateinf:...
rtransfer:...
rgrowth:...
rsenesced:...
diseased:...
severity:Disease severity or incidence (for tungro).

Details

SEIR is called by the following specific disease modelling functions:

  • predict_bacterial_blight,

  • predict_brown_spot,

  • predict_leaf_blast,

  • predict_sheath_blight,

  • predict_tungro

Author

Serge Savary, Ireneo Pangga, Robert Hijmans, Jorrel Khalil Aunario, Adam H. Sparks, Aji Sukarta

Examples

# \donttest{
# get weather for IRRI Zeigler Experiment Station in dry season 2000
wth <- get_wth(
  lonlat = c(121.25562, 14.6774),
  dates = c("2000-01-15", "2000-05-31")
)

# provide suitable values for brown spot severity
age_rc <-
  cbind(0:6 * 20, c(0.35, 0.35, 0.35, 0.47, 0.59, 0.71, 1.0))
tmp_rc <-
  cbind(T = 15 + (0:5) * 5, RcT = c(0, 0.06, 1.0, 0.85, 0.16, 0))
rh_rc <- cbind(RH_hr = 0:8 * 3,
             RcRH = c(0, 0.12, 0.20, 0.38, 0.46, 0.60, 0.73, 0.87, 1.0))
emergence <- "2000-01-15"

x <- SEIR(
  wth = wth,
  emergence = emergence,
  age_rc = age_rc,
  tmp_rc = tmp_rc,
  rh_rc = rh_rc,
  base_rc = 0.61,
  latrans = 6,
  inftrans = 19,
  init_sites = 600,
  aggr = 1,
  site_max = 100000,
  rr_physiol_senesc = 0.01,
  rrg = 0.1
)
# }
